newsitem.title: USA: U.S. wheat weekly export sales highlights -- USDA.
newsitem.headline: U.S. wheat weekly export sales highlights -- USDA.

text.p: USDA wheat export sales highlights in latest reporting week:
Net sales of 253,200 metric tons (MT) were 49 percent below the previous week and 39 percent under the 4-week average.

Major increases reported for Egypt (60,000 MT), South Korea (52,500 MT), Iraq (50,000 MT), and Nigeria (32,500 MT) were partially offset due to decreases for El Salvador (30,000 MT--switched to 1997/98), unknown destinations (25,500 MT), and Japan (24,700 MT).
Sales activity of 51,000 MT for the 1997/98 marketing year were primarily for El Salvador (35,000 MT) and Mexico (15,000 MT).

Exports of 511,100 MT were two-thirds above the week earlier and one-third above the 4-week average. The principal recipients were Pakistan (175,300 MT), the Philippines (102,400 MT), Taiwan (52,300 MT), Indonesia (29,700 MT), and Venezuela (29,300 MT).
